cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 95 miles ENE of Daytona Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north along the Florida/Georgia coast, expected to turn northeast Thursday and skirt the South Carolina and North Carolina coasts before accelerating northeastward well offshore of the Mid-Atlantic toward Atlantic Canada.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch is posted from the NC/VA border to Chincoteague, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point (south of Delaware).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Storm-Surge Warnings cover Florida’s east coast northward to Surf City, NC; none currently extend to Delaware.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through North Carolina, then portions of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts as the storm moves northeast offshore.
weather_observation.wind: There is a 26% cumulative chance of sustained tropical-storm-force (≥34 kt) winds, peaking near 25% early Saturday (about 150-175 miles offshore). Gusty easterly winds 30–40 mph are possible Friday night into early Saturday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; surge guidance keeps values below 3 ft along the Delaware coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible Friday–Saturday, locally higher in bands, but widespread 4-inch totals are not indicated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning well before the center’s closest approach may affect port operations.
